Body: So I've been operating my unlocked Samsung Galaxy Nexus (carrier is T-Mobile) with the 4.3 operating system. Obviously, this is incredibly out of date but I haven't had any problems with it until recently. I've realized that my apps have been updating but I never updated to Lollipop, let alone Marshmallow. Now apps are crashing (not compatible?) and phone is incredibly slow. I thought Google phones unlocked like mine automatically updated the OS. Why wouldn't my phone automatically update to Lollipop? Can I still update? Can this phone update to Marshmallow?
Title: updating android Galaxy Nexus with Android Version 4.3

history.Text: So I've been operating my **unlocked** Samsung Galaxy Nexus (carrier is T-Mobile) with the 4.3 operating system. Obviously, this is incredibly out of date but I haven't had any problems with it until recently. I've realized that my apps have been updating but I never updated to Lollipop, let alone Marshmallow. Now apps are crashing (not compatible?) and phone is incredibly slow. I thought Google phones unlocked like mine automatically updated the OS. Why wouldn't my phone automatically update to Lollipop? Can I still update? Can this phone update to Marshmallow?
updating android Galaxy Nexus with Android Version 4.3
